name: Linux Kernel Module File
summary: Learn about .KO files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: KO modules may be loaded by using the insmod Linux program. Installed kernel modules can be listed using the lsmod program, or they may be browsed in the /​proc/​modules directory.

As of Linux kernel version 2.6, KO files are used in place of .O files and contain additional information that the kernel uses to load modules. The Linux program modpost can be used to convert O files into KO files.
NOTE: KO files may also be loaded by FreeBSD using the kldload program.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
